docs.title: F5 XC Chrome Plugin
docs.text: Chrome browser automation for F5 Distributed Cloud console - navigate, crawl, and automate XC GUI operations.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This Claude Code plugin provides browser automation capabilities for the F5 Distributed Cloud (XC) web console. It uses the Claude in Chrome extension to interact with the console GUI, enabling automated navigation, form filling, and data extraction.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Multi-Provider Authentication - Azure SSO, Google, Okta, SAML, and native login
  • Deterministic Navigation - Pre-crawled stable selectors for reliable automation
  • Form Automation - Fill HTTP Load Balancer, Origin Pool, and WAF forms
  • Console Crawling - Extract and refresh navigation metadata
  • Real-time Feedback - Watch automation in your browser

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text: Resource Description Installation Get started with the plugin Commands Available commands reference Manifest Machine-readable metadata Workflows Pre-built automation workflows

docs.title: Console Crawling
docs.text: The plugin can crawl the F5 XC console to extract navigation metadata.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Console crawling builds the console-navigation-metadata.json and url-sitemap.json files that enable deterministic navigation.

Pre-Crawled Metadata

The plugin ships with pre-crawled metadata that works out of the box. Crawling is optional - use it to refresh stale data or update after F5 XC console UI changes.

docs.title: Running a Crawl
docs.text: /xc:console crawl https://yourname.console.ves.volterra.io

docs.title: URL Sitemap
docs.text:
• Static Routes - Fixed paths like /web/home, /web/workspaces/...
  • Dynamic Routes - Paths with variables like /namespaces/{namespace}/...
  • Workspace Mapping - Shorthand aliases
  • Resource Shortcuts - Quick navigation helpers

docs.title: Element Metadata
docs.text:
• Element Refs - Session-specific references
  • Stable Selectors - Cross-session selectors
  • data_testid - Testing attributes
  • aria_label - Accessibility labels
  • text_match - Text content
  • css - CSS selectors

docs.title: Crawl Coverage
docs.text: Metric Value Metadata Version 2.2.0 Pages Crawled 3 Workspaces Discovered 22 Form Fields 25 Static Routes 23 Dynamic Patterns 9 Last Crawled 2025-12-24T21:35:00Z

docs.title: Crawl Process
docs.text:
flowchart LR
    A[Start] --> B[Navigate Home]
    B --> C[Extract Workspace Cards]
    C --> D[Visit Each Workspace]
    D --> E[Extract Sidebar Items]
    E --> F[Visit Resource Pages]
    F --> G[Extract Form Fields]
    G --> H[Save Metadata]

docs.title: Refreshing Metadata
docs.text:
Run a crawl when:

  • Console UI has been updated
  • New workspaces are added
  • Form fields change
  • Navigation paths move
# Full crawl
/xc:console crawl https://yourname.console.ves.volterra.io

# Verify updated metadata
cat skills/xc-console/console-navigation-metadata.json | jq .version

docs.title: Navigation
docs.text: The plugin provides deterministic navigation using pre-crawled metadata.

docs.title: Selector Priority Chain
docs.text:
The automation uses this selector priority for reliable element targeting:

  1. data_testid
  2. aria_label
  3. text_match
  4. css
  5. ref

docs.title: Before v2.2 (Session-Specific Refs)
docs.text:
Claude: Uses ref_27 from metadata
Risk: Refs change between browser sessions
Result: ~70% success rate

docs.title: After v2.2 (Stable Selectors)
docs.text:
Claude: Uses data_testid > aria_label > text_match fallback
Uses: mcp__claude-in-chrome__find with stable selector
Result: ~95% success rate across sessions

docs.title: Basic Navigation
docs.text:
/xc:console nav home      # Go to console home
/xc:console nav waap      # Go to WAAP workspace
/xc:console nav http-lb   # Go to HTTP Load Balancers

docs.title: Workspace Shortcuts
docs.text: Shortcut Path account /web/workspaces/account-protection admin /web/workspaces/administration audit /web/workspaces/audit-logs-alerts auth /web/workspaces/authentication-intelligence bigip /web/workspaces/bigip-utilities bot /web/workspaces/bot-defense catalog /web/catalog/use-cases cdn /web/workspaces/content-delivery-network csd /web/workspaces/client-side-defense data-intel /web/workspaces/data-intelligence ddos /web/workspaces/routed-ddos delegated /web/workspaces/delegated-access dns /web/workspaces/dns-management home /web/home mac /web/workspaces/multi-cloud-app-connect mcn /web/workspaces/multi-cloud-network-connect nginx /web/workspaces/nginx-one observe /web/workspaces/observability scan /web/workspaces/web-app-scanning shared /web/workspaces/shared-configuration traffic /web/workspaces/application-traffic-insight waap /web/workspaces/web-app-and-api-protection

docs.title: Element Metadata Structure
docs.text:
Each element includes both refs and stable selectors:

{
  "add_button": {
    "ref": "ref_27",
    "text": "Add HTTP Load Balancer",
    "selectors": {
      "data_testid": null,
      "aria_label": "Add HTTP Load Balancer",
      "text_match": "Add HTTP Load Balancer",
      "css": "button:has-text('Add HTTP Load Balancer')"
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Fallback Strategy
docs.text:
When navigating, Claude uses this priority:

  1. Try data_testid selector (most stable)
  2. Try aria_label selector
  3. Try text_match with find()
  4. Try css selector
  5. Try session-specific ref (may be stale)
  6. Report mismatch for metadata update

docs.title: Via Command
docs.text: /xc:console create http-lb

docs.title: Via Natural Language
docs.text:
claude --chrome

"Create an HTTP load balancer named demo-lb with:
- Namespace: production
- Domain: demo.example.com
- Origin pool: backend-pool
- WAF: enabled"

docs.title: Creating New Workflows
docs.text:
1. Create workflow file in skills/xc-console/workflows/
  2. Follow existing patterns (see http-loadbalancer-create-basic.md)
  3. Test with /xc:console create <type>

See the Workflow Patterns documentation for details.

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: The plugin supports multiple authentication providers for F5 XC console access.

docs.title: Supported Providers
docs.text: Auth Type URL Pattern Claude Can Automate? Native U/P login*.volterra.us ❌ User enters creds Azure SSO login.microsoftonline.com ⚠️ Only if cached Google SSO accounts.google.com ⚠️ Only if cached Okta SSO *.okta.com ⚠️ Only if cached Generic SAML /saml/, /sso/ ⚠️ Only if cached Already Logged In /web/workspaces/ ✅ Yes Connection Failed timeout/error ❌ Warn about VPN

docs.title: Auto-Flow Sequence
docs.text:
flowchart TD
    A[Navigate to Tenant URL] --> B{Connection OK?}
    B -->|No| C[Warn about VPN]
    B -->|Yes| D{Check Auth State}
    D -->|Already Logged In| E[Continue to Task]
    D -->|Login Required| F{Identify Auth Type}
    F -->|Native| G[User enters credentials]
    F -->|SSO| H{Cached Session?}
    H -->|Yes| I[Auto-redirect]
    H -->|No| J[User completes SSO]
    G --> E
    I --> E
    J --> E

docs.title: Detection Triggers
docs.text:
The plugin detects login requirements when:

  • URL redirects to login page (login*.volterra.us, login.microsoftonline.com, etc.)
  • Page contains "Sign in", "Go to login", or "Session expired" messages
  • Connection times out (may require VPN)

docs.title: Automatic (Cached Sessions)
docs.text:
If you have an active browser session, the plugin uses it automatically:

/xc:console login https://yourname.console.ves.volterra.io

# Claude will detect existing session and proceed

docs.title: Manual (Credentials Required)
docs.text:
When credentials are needed:

/xc:console login https://yourname.console.ves.volterra.io

# Claude: "I see a login page. Azure SSO button is visible."
# You: Click SSO button and complete authentication
# Tell Claude: "I've logged in, continue with the task"

docs.title: VPN Requirements
docs.text:
Some tenants require VPN access. The plugin detects connection timeouts and warns:

⚠️ Connection timeout detected. This tenant may require VPN access.
Please ensure you're connected to the appropriate VPN and try again.

docs.title: 1. Claude in Chrome Extension
docs.text:
Install from the Chrome Web Store and verify connection:

# Visit Chrome Web Store and install "Claude in Chrome" extension
# Pin the extension to your toolbar for easy access

# Verify connection
claude --chrome

docs.title: 2. F5 XC Tenant Access
docs.text:
• Azure AD, Google, Okta, or SAML credentials with tenant access
  • Valid tenant URL (e.g., https://yourname.console.ves.volterra.io)

docs.title: From GitHub
docs.text:
# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/robinmordasiewicz/f5xc-chrome.git

# Install as Claude Code plugin
claude plugin install ./f5xc-chrome

docs.title: Direct Usage
docs.text:
# Use directly without installing
claude --plugin-dir /path/to/f5xc-chrome

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
# Start Claude Code with Chrome integration
claude --chrome

# Check plugin is loaded
/xc:console status

docs.title: Environment Variables (Optional)
docs.text:
For CLI-based verification:

export F5XC_API_URL="https://yourname.console.ves.volterra.io"
export F5XC_API_TOKEN='your-api-token'

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
# Start Claude Code with Chrome integration
claude --chrome

# Login to your tenant
/xc:console login https://yourname.console.ves.volterra.io

# Navigate to HTTP Load Balancers
/xc:console nav http-lb

# Create a new load balancer
/xc:console create http-lb

docs.title: Create HTTP Load Balancer
docs.text:
claude --chrome

"I want to create an HTTP load balancer in F5 XC.

Please:
1. Navigate to https://nferreira.staging.volterra.us
2. Find and click the 'HTTP Load Balancers' page
3. Click 'Add HTTP Load Balancer' button
4. Fill in:
   - Name: demo-lb
   - Namespace: production
   - Domains: demo.example.com
5. Don't submit yet - just show me the form filled in."

docs.title: Explore Console Structure
docs.text:
claude --chrome

"Help me inventory the F5 Distributed Cloud console.

Navigate to https://nferreira.staging.volterra.us and:
1. Look at the main left sidebar menu
2. For each top-level menu item, tell me:
   - The menu item name
   - Any submenus
   - What page appears when clicked

Take screenshots of key pages."

docs.title: Console Metadata
docs.text: The console-navigation-metadata.json file contains element selectors for browser automation.

docs.title: Current Status

docs.title: Selector Priority
docs.text:
The automation uses this selector priority for reliable element targeting:

  1. data_testid
  2. aria_label
  3. text_match
  4. css
  5. ref

docs.title: Workspace Cards
docs.text:
Available workspace cards on the home page:

Workspace URL Path Web App & API Protection /web/workspaces/web-app-and-api-protection Multi-Cloud Network Connect /web/workspaces/multi-cloud-network-connect Multi-Cloud App Connect /web/workspaces/multi-cloud-app-connect Distributed Apps /web/workspaces/distributed-apps DNS Management /web/workspaces/dns-management Bot Defense /web/workspaces/bot-defense Content Delivery Network /web/workspaces/content-delivery-network Administration /web/workspaces/administration

docs.title: Refreshing Metadata
docs.text:
/xc:console crawl https://yourname.console.ves.volterra.io

This updates all element refs and stable selectors.

docs.title: Selector Reference
docs.text: This page documents the selector types and their usage in the plugin.

docs.title: Selector Priority Chain
docs.text:
The automation uses this selector priority for reliable element targeting:

  1. data_testid
  2. aria_label
  3. text_match
  4. css
  5. ref

docs.title: data_testid
docs.text:
Stability: Highest

Testing attributes added by developers. Most stable but often not available.

<button data-testid="add-lb-btn">Add Load Balancer</button>

// CSS selector
[data-testid="add-lb-btn"]

docs.title: aria_label
docs.text:
Stability: High

Accessibility labels. Stable and often available for interactive elements.

<button aria-label="Add Load Balancer">+</button>

// CSS selector
[aria-label="Add Load Balancer"]

docs.title: text_match
docs.text:
Stability: Medium

Text content matching using find() tool.

// find() query
"Add HTTP Load Balancer"

docs.title: css
docs.text:
Stability: Medium

CSS selectors for complex matching patterns.

// With text matching
"button:has-text('Add HTTP Load Balancer')"

// With class and structure
".workspace-card:has-text('Web App')"

// With input type
"input[type='search']"

docs.title: ref
docs.text:
Stability: Session-only

Session-specific element references. Only valid within the session they were captured.

"ref_27"

Session Dependency

Refs are captured during crawl and may become stale. Always prefer stable selectors.

docs.title: Selector Metadata Structure
docs.text:
Each element in the metadata includes all selector types:

{
  "add_button": {
    "ref": "ref_27",
    "text": "Add HTTP Load Balancer",
    "selectors": {
      "data_testid": null,
      "aria_label": "Add HTTP Load Balancer",
      "text_match": "Add HTTP Load Balancer",
      "css": "button:has-text('Add HTTP Load Balancer')"
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Fallback Strategy
docs.text:
When locating an element, the plugin tries selectors in priority order:

def find_element(metadata):
    selectors = metadata["selectors"]

    # 1. Try data_testid (most stable)
    if selectors.get("data_testid"):
        return find_by_css(f'[data-testid="{selectors["data_testid"]}"]')

    # 2. Try aria_label
    if selectors.get("aria_label"):
        return find_by_css(f'[aria-label="{selectors["aria_label"]}"]')

    # 3. Try text_match
    if selectors.get("text_match"):
        return find_by_text(selectors["text_match"])

    # 4. Try css selector
    if selectors.get("css"):
        return find_by_css(selectors["css"])

    # 5. Try session ref (may be stale)
    if metadata.get("ref"):
        return find_by_ref(metadata["ref"])

    # 6. Report failure
    raise ElementNotFoundError()

docs.title: Current Coverage
docs.text:
The crawl summary shows selector coverage:

{
  "crawl_summary": {
    "total_refs": 150,
    "elements_with_stable_selectors": 45,
    "selector_coverage_percentage": 30
  }
}

docs.title: Running a Crawl
docs.text:
To improve coverage, run a fresh crawl:

/xc:console crawl https://yourname.console.ves.volterra.io

The crawl extracts all available selector types for each element.

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Prefer stable selectors - Use data_testid or aria_label when available
  2. Use text_match as fallback - Good for buttons and links
  3. Avoid css selectors - They're fragile to UI changes
  4. Never rely on refs alone - They expire between sessions
  5. Re-crawl after UI updates - Refresh metadata when the console changes

docs.title: Macro Syntax Error
docs.text:
File: metadata/sitemap.md

Line 124 in Markdown file: expected token ':', got '}' 

        url = url.replace(f"{{{key}}}", value)

docs.title: MCP Tools
docs.text:
The plugin uses Claude in Chrome MCP tools for browser automation.

Tool mcp__claude-in-chrome__tabs_context_mcp mcp__claude-in-chrome__navigate mcp__claude-in-chrome__read_page mcp__claude-in-chrome__computer mcp__claude-in-chrome__find mcp__claude-in-chrome__form_input mcp__claude-in-chrome__get_page_text mcp__claude-in-chrome__javascript_tool

docs.title: Tool Descriptions
docs.text: Tool Purpose tabs_context_mcp Get browser tab context and IDs navigate Navigate to URLs read_page Read page elements and structure computer Click, type, screenshot, scroll find Find elements by description form_input Fill form fields get_page_text Extract page text content javascript_tool Execute JavaScript in page context

docs.title: data_testid
docs.text:
Most stable selector, used by developers for testing.

[data-testid="add-lb-btn"]

docs.title: aria_label
docs.text:
Accessibility labels, fairly stable.

[aria-label="Add Load Balancer"]

docs.title: text_match
docs.text:
Text content matching, used with find().

"Add HTTP Load Balancer"

docs.title: css
docs.text:
CSS selectors for complex matching.

".workspace-card:has-text('Web App')"

docs.title: ref
docs.text:
Session-specific references, may become stale.

"ref_27"

docs.title: Static Routes
docs.text:
Fixed paths that don't change:

/web/home
/web/catalog/use-cases
/web/workspaces/web-app-and-api-protection

docs.title: Dynamic Routes
docs.text:
Paths with variable segments:

/web/workspaces/{workspace}/namespaces/{namespace}/manage/{resource_type}

Variables:

  • {workspace} - Workspace slug
  • {namespace} - Tenant namespace
  • {resource_type} - Resource type slug
  • {resource_id} - Resource identifier

docs.title: Basic Workflow Structure
docs.text:
---
name: workflow-name
description: What this workflow does
---

# Workflow Name

## Prerequisites
- Required setup steps

## Steps

### Step 1: Navigate
Navigate to the target page.

### Step 2: Fill Form
Fill required fields.

### Step 3: Submit
Review and submit.

## Validation
Verify the result.

docs.title: Field Definitions
docs.text:
{
  "field_name": {
    "ref": "ref_123",
    "type": "textbox|listbox|checkbox|spinbutton",
    "required": true,
    "selectors": {
      "data_testid": null,
      "aria_label": "Field Label",
      "text_match": null,
      "css": "input[name='field']"
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Console Command
docs.text: The main command for F5 XC console automation.

docs.title: Syntax
docs.text: /xc:console <subcommand> [options]

docs.title: Subcommands
docs.text: Command Description Example login <url> Authenticate to tenant /xc:console login https://tenant.volterra.us crawl <url> Refresh navigation metadata /xc:console crawl https://tenant.volterra.us nav <target> Navigate to workspace/page /xc:console nav waap create <type> Start resource creation /xc:console create http-lb status Show connection status /xc:console status

docs.title: Login Command
docs.text:
Authenticate to an F5 XC tenant.

/xc:console login https://yourname.console.ves.volterra.io

The command:

  1. Gets browser context
  2. Navigates to tenant URL
  3. Detects auth type (native, SSO, or already logged in)
  4. Handles accordingly (inform user or auto-complete)
  5. Confirms successful login

docs.title: Navigation Command
docs.text:
Navigate to a workspace or page.

/xc:console nav <target>

docs.title: Available Targets
docs.text: Shortcut Path account /web/workspaces/account-protection admin /web/workspaces/administration audit /web/workspaces/audit-logs-alerts auth /web/workspaces/authentication-intelligence bigip /web/workspaces/bigip-utilities bot /web/workspaces/bot-defense catalog /web/catalog/use-cases cdn /web/workspaces/content-delivery-network csd /web/workspaces/client-side-defense data-intel /web/workspaces/data-intelligence ddos /web/workspaces/routed-ddos delegated /web/workspaces/delegated-access dns /web/workspaces/dns-management home /web/home mac /web/workspaces/multi-cloud-app-connect mcn /web/workspaces/multi-cloud-network-connect nginx /web/workspaces/nginx-one observe /web/workspaces/observability scan /web/workspaces/web-app-scanning shared /web/workspaces/shared-configuration traffic /web/workspaces/application-traffic-insight waap /web/workspaces/web-app-and-api-protection

docs.title: Create Command
docs.text:
Start resource creation workflow.

/xc:console create <resource-type>

docs.title: Resource Types
docs.text: Type Description http-lb HTTP Load Balancer tcp-lb TCP Load Balancer origin-pool Origin Pool waf WAF Policy service-policy Service Policy

docs.title: Crawl Command
docs.text:
Refresh console navigation metadata.

/xc:console crawl https://yourname.console.ves.volterra.io

This updates:

  • console-navigation-metadata.json - Element selectors
  • url-sitemap.json - URL routing

docs.title: Status Command
docs.text:
Show current connection and session status.

/xc:console status

Displays:

  • Chrome extension connection status
  • Current tab URL
  • Authentication state
  • Metadata version

docs.title: Manifest Reference
docs.text: The plugin generates a machine-readable manifest for downstream consumption.

docs.title: Manifest Location
docs.text:
• Root: manifest.json - Generated manifest (gitignored)
  • Docs: @docs/data/manifest.json - MkDocs data source (gitignored)

docs.title: Generation
docs.text:
python scripts/generate-manifest.py

This aggregates:

  • .claude-plugin/plugin.json
  • skills/xc-console/console-navigation-metadata.json
  • skills/xc-console/url-sitemap.json
  • Git metadata

docs.title: Schema
docs.text:
{
  "$schema": "https://f5xc-chrome.github.io/schema/manifest-v1.json",
  "manifest_version": "1.0.0",
  "generated_at": "2025-12-24T00:00:00Z",

  "plugin": {
    "name": "xc",
    "version": "0.3.0",
    "description": "...",
    "author": {},
    "license": "MIT",
    "repository": "...",
    "keywords": []
  },

  "build": {
    "commit": "abc123",
    "branch": "main",
    "tag": "v0.3.0"
  },

  "console_metadata": {
    "version": "2.2.0",
    "tenant": "...",
    "last_crawled": "...",
    "selector_priority": [],
    "authentication": {},
    "stats": {}
  },

  "url_sitemap": {
    "version": "2.2.0",
    "coverage": {},
    "workspace_mapping": {},
    "resource_shortcuts": {},
    "static_route_count": 23,
    "dynamic_pattern_count": 9
  },

  "skills": [],
  "workflows": [],
  "mcp_tools": [],
  "commands": [],
  "documentation": {},
  "ecosystem": []
}

docs.title: In MkDocs
docs.text:
The manifest data is available through macros:

docs.title: Programmatically
docs.text:
import json
from urllib.request import urlopen

manifest_url = "https://robinmordasiewicz.github.io/f5xc-chrome/data/manifest.json"
manifest = json.loads(urlopen(manifest_url).read())

print(f"Plugin version: {manifest['plugin']['version']}")
print(f"Metadata version: {manifest['console_metadata']['version']}")

docs.title: In CI/CD
docs.text:
- name: Check manifest version
  run: |
    VERSION=$(jq -r '.plugin.version' manifest.json)
    echo "Plugin version: $VERSION"

docs.title: Data Files
docs.text:
Individual data files are also generated:

File Contents @docs/data/plugin.json Plugin identity @docs/data/console_metadata.json Console crawl stats @docs/data/url_sitemap.json URL routing @docs/data/workflows.json Available workflows
